History of Present Illness (HPI): The patient has been reflecting on their temper, particularly after a recent argument with their ex regarding their children. They felt frustrated during the conversation, indicating a struggle to manage emotions when overwhelmed.
Current Functional Status: The patient is studying for a real estate exam, aiming to dedicate at least an hour each day to studying, although they acknowledge facing distractions.
Therapeutic Interventions: The patient is learning grounding exercises to manage frustration and is working on a structured study plan for their real estate exam.
Next Steps: The patient will practice the breathing technique and adhere to their study schedule before the next session.
